summary: The deposits here are abundant, but they come with complications. Coal produces excessive ash, and copper requires water to extract effectively.

With only a single mining drill, progress has been painfully slow. I first had to mine enough iron to craft pipes, so I could channel water to copper veins and craft additional drills. Every machine also requires manual coal refueling, meaning constant back-and-forth trips to break rocks for fuel and return to the drill.

Nightfall brought more dangers. Giant bugs attacked the site. I call them biters because they try to bite into everything. Fortunately, they came one at a time, and I was able to fend them off. To bolster defenses, I crafted about half a dozen small turrets and surrounded them with wooden fences, protecting the mining drills and securing the perimeter.
By morning, the immediate threats had vanished. I was able to take advantage of the calm to lay out blueprints for future miner placements, preparing for a more efficient expansion in the days ahead.
